reviewText:
The bone-chilling, nerve-wracking animatronic antics of Five Night's at Freddy's are back, and this time they mean business.

Enter the newly rennovated pizza parlor of Freddy Fazbear himself as him and his bot buddies conspire to rip your ♥♥♥♥ing face off. What's that? There's only five bots, so it's not too hard? Haha!

No doors, no gimmicks, just straight you and your wit and sanity in an all out night with the gang, including six new bots, new mechanics and much more!

POINT AND CLICK GAMES HAVE NEVER BEEN THIS SCARY!
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I really WANT to love this game, but in its current state, the only way to play it as it is intended to be played is on Night 2.  What I mean by this is that you are supposed to keep track of where your enemies are at all times by checking each room through the cameras while frequently winding the music box and protecting yourself with the mask... in theory. In practice, however, it inevitably breaks down into this formula:

Night 1: You get attacked once, maybe twice by only 1 enemy (Bonnie 2.0, who moves very slowly and very predictably), not counting the Marionette. Cakewalk.

Night 2: Optimized difficulty. You have to balance the music box, your immediate surroundings, and your distant surroundings to fend off all the anamatronics. Foxy and the Marionette will murder the ♥♥♥♥ out of you if you neglect the music box or the hallway lights.

Nights 3-6: There is so much ♥♥♥♥ going on, you're basically only checking and responding to the immediate areas around the office while sparing the 5 seconds you have between encounters to wind the music box. If you spend ANY time searching for the anamatronics outside of the vents or the front hallway, you are wasting your time and WILL die, considering that there are now 11 of the ♥♥♥♥ers out for your flesh instead of the first game's 5 - and that at ANY given time ONE of them WILL be poking their head into your office if they're not already right in front of you.

For the latter 2/3rds of the game, all it is (in it's current state, as of this review,) is just spamming lights, lights, lights, mask, music box, mask, lights, and lights and lights. Do it fast enough, you win. Stagger your pace, Freddy ♥♥♥♥s your face.

...still, the game is such a novelty, I can't NOT recommend it.

reviewText:
Welcome back to the new and improved Freddy Fazbears Pizzeria!
Meet the toys and have loads of fun!
Warning: Freddy Fazbears will not be held responsible in Loss of life or damage to self.

So then looks like we have to take this night shift again hold on tight as i review FIVE NIGHTS AT FREDDY'S 2
Before i start i have to say that this game is a prequel yes it is a prequel and i have loads of proof but i will not say it all as i will sum up the series in FNAF 3 the final game.
So there are so many more animatronics like the toys and the old withered ones.
I will read the mall out including the easter egg ones!
Toy Freddy, Toy Bonnie, Toy Chica, The Mangle/Toy Foxy, Balloon Boy/BB, Balloon Girl/JJ, The Marrionette, The Endo Skeleton, Shadow Freddy, Shadow Bonnie, Old Freddy, Old Bonnie, Old Chica, Old Foxy and Golden Freddy.

So then the aim of the game is like the last one!
Survive Five Nights
Then get the bonus 6th night and then the custom night!
The games mechanics are much diffferent in this game though!
You have to wind up an annoying music box so The Marrionette does not come and eat you're face.
A mask you put on to scare the animatronics away.
You have to put it on at the speed of light!
And did i mention?
THERE ARE NO DOORS!
So did i like this game?
Yes i loved it!
We found out a bit more about the 5 Missing Children Incident!
So then thanx for reading this!
Oh Btw
Don't wake the baby...

reviewText:
This is a great sequel to a game that deserved so much attention.

The atmospheric sounds in this game creates more tension and suspense.

Scott did a fantastic job on this game, in only 2 months, not like any other highly anticipated game. This game was made in 2 months. This Five Nights At Freddy's has new and unique mechanics with the new music box that awakens something you don't want to meet. And the new mask creates more scares and suspese.

You can tell if there's going to be a jumpscare in the first game. With the whining noise that the animatronics make, but now it's harder to tell if you'll die. With some random chance when you put on the mask starting on Night 3.

Balloon Boy makes things much more interesting with him cutting out the lights. This game makes people who can multi-task look stupid. This game takes so much thought. Or none. But it's a good cheap game for playing if you're bored or want to do some let's play.

PROS
- New Music Box Mechanic
- New Mask Element
- New Flashlight
- More animatronics
- Old animatronics reintroduced
- No doors (creating challenges)
- Presets in Custom Night Menu
- Rewards for completing preset nights.
- Runs well on most systems
- Unique mini-games creating more questions and theories
- LOTS and LOTS of Easter Eggs (and scary ones)

CONS
- Sometimes can get too hard for some players.
- Only runs on Windows, and not Mac or Linux.

OVERALL:

84/100

This is my honest opinion. Please correct me or tell me your opinions.

reviewText:
I love the Five Nights at Freddy's Franchise and this game takes it up a notch, but that's kind of an issue.

Pros-

Puts Pressure on you.
Animatronics designed well.
Audio fits in great.
Cool mechanics.
Scary atmosphere.
Awesome Jumpscares.
Slight replay value.



Cons-

Needs lots of reflexes.
If you're too fast the mask won't go up.
Animatronics are too similar, like Withered Bonnie and Withered Chica are too similar.
Camera mechanic isn't used enough.
Music box gets annoying.
Freddy isn't even main Antagonist.
Flashlight doesn't help much on later nights (Excluding Foxy)
Replay value is kind of short.

I rate this game 6/10

reviewText:
This game blew me away on how creative it is, and how it takes a more interesting tole in the series.
It's so atmospheric despite the fact being in a restaurant. It keeps you going more then in the first game.
It keeps you thinking, and it's mind blowning.
It creates a bigger challenge for you, keeps you multi tasking, and there is always a surprise waiting around the corner.
If you love playing games that are full of jumpscares, this is for you.
It's everything you'd want to have in a sequel, that is if it is a sequel.

reviewText: OMG ALL TEH SPOOKS #3SPOOKY5ME I NEDD SUM HALP TO GET RAD OF TEH NAGHTMARES FROM TIS GAM!\n\nBut seriously, this is in my opinion the best game in the FNAF series thus far and is probably the hardest. This game provides a nice challenge and isn't super easy like the 1st game, balls to the walls difficult as the 3rd game or super sound required like the 4th game requiring you to wear headphones at full volume, making you extremely susceptible to being deafened by the jumpscares. Despite the 10x20 mode being the hardest in the series and the music box can and will be the death of you multiple times, for only $7.99, it is worth a purchase if you are into the Horror Survival Genre. I give this game a 9/10, only losing a point becuase I had to bleach my eyeballs after googling Toy Chica.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Thought the first one was scary? Think again, this one may be a prequel but it's even scarier than the first game and the worst part is, there are no doors. Luckily you have a Freddy Fazbear Head so if you can use the Flashlight and the head as a team while winding the music box to prevent a certain animatronic from coming out of its box, you should be able to survive the first 3 nights before it starts to get really difficult. If you're a fan of the series, I recommend getting this. The nights are a bit shorter than the first game's, but don't get comfortable with that fact. Since there are no doors, you can't just sit idly by to easily survive Nights 1 and 2, you have to actually start reacting accordingly or you'll end up jumping out of your seat by an unexpected jumpscare.

reviewText: This is the second game for Five Nights At Freddy's series and as may a lot of you think that it is a sequel, its actually a prequel. It has a very long, interestind also disturbing and very deep story which will make you want to discover every secret this game has, encluding the minigames. But even without the story line this is one of the most horrifying games you will ever play with its heartstopping jumpscares! If you think that the first game was scary you will just crap the ♥♥♥♥ out of your self just by playing for few minutes. The main adding to this game is a lot more animatronics apart from the first game wich had only 4 animotronics this one has 10! I SAID FREAKING 10 ANIMATRONICS, not counting golden freddy. every single one has very unique AI! Plus no doors! This game will really make you see nightmares in your dreams! And just when you thaught that freddy will not attack at least untill night 3 then you were wrong he comes out from the first night! But even though you will think that it won't get harder you will be absolutely wrong because you havent seen the puppet yet! That thing is creepy as hell! anyway wont spoil any more of gameplay ill just say this is one of the most scary games ever!\n9.9/10\njust because the music box makes other cameras useless :D

reviewText: Five Nights at Freddy's 2 is both a sequel cause of the game name and a pre-quel for the story. This game like the first game has simlar gameplay and presentation with a few things added. In the first game, there were only 5 animatronics but this game has 11 animatronics with 5 of them returning from the previous game. You must survive from 12 AM to 6 AM (almost 9 mins.) The only thing u can do is check the cameras to see where all the animatroincs are, use your flashlight not only in the cameras but in the air vents and main hallway. One of the new addtitions in this game is the Freddy Fazbear's head which will fool almost every animatronic except the old Foxy and the Puppet. Sometimes when you die, you will be brought to a game where you play as an animatronic. This actually are hints into the true story of Five Nights at Freddy's. Speaking of the story, this is one of those games that has a story hidden well.\nI give this game 8 out of 10 because the game is short. In the end, this is a game that many people will be talking about until the creator finished the series.

reviewText:
- Five Night's at Freddy's 2 is a sequel to the game: Three Weekend's at Burnies, where you sit in your office having a slumber party with your robot friends, cause you're too fat and lonely to go make some real friends in the outside world. Your father, who's name you never took to learning, calls you every day to warn you about where the Pizza pops are, and how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a life you have.

- Your friend who has a fetish for pirates has ADHD and loves to jump at you, make sure not to feed him sugar.
- The siblings, ♥♥♥♥♥ica, and Bernie, (the new ones) love shoving themselves in small areas, such as the two cubby holes in the side of your room.
- Freddy, old and new, hate you very much, and never give you time to react to their surprise smack cams." Make sure to give them a little bit of extra hate.

reviewText:
This review isn't about the game itself.... Maybe a little, but it's more about the Fnaf community that rose from it.
..... I can't describe what has the community turned into, and it's saddening to even watch or listen to. 'Cause alot of you people I've seen have been just acting so bat ♥♥♥♥ crazy over Fnaf, and you only like FNAF related things, and because of people like you are breaking down possible youtube celebrities, our next generation of youtubers going down the drain...
It's saddening to see how they are crumbling down because of YOU, but you don't care, do you? You just care about Fnaf's overly done observations, you're like children trying to find out the way to solve a rubix cube and how it's made.

I've seen enough from this community to just seperate myself from it. Sorry, but not sorry to say that I hope the Fnaf community falls faster like the original o.W.n did for the toxicity of people just over doing it. And I hope that Fnaf the game itself dies with the community..... Oh wait, it already has, and I hope it won't rise from the rot again.

The game was good while it lasted, but I'm just tired of it's existance.



Go ahead and yell at me, scream at me, send me your hate mail if you're one of those people who disagree blindly. But those who do agree with me, will have a virtualized cookie.

reviewText:
This game sucks, if you play it you are probably 12 or a youtuber.

But seriously, this game is pretty bad. The mechanic of putting the mask on is not fun it can lead to what feel like some cheep deaths, it feels like it is a fifty/fifty chance you will actually survive. If your playing this game for the horror aspect, don't. This game is not scary in the slightest. This is the worst game in the series.

This game is also frustratingly overwhelming, take the first game for example. on the first night, you have to worry about Bonnie and Chica, two. Then night two introduces Foxy, now three. Then Freddy enters joins the gang leaving us with four animatronics. But in Five Nights two we start of against Toys Freddy, Bonnie, and Chica, already at three. Then they add three more, Mangle, W. Foxy, and Balloon Boy, now six on the second night, that's more than in the first game even if you count Golden Freddy. I also didn’t count the Marionette that is always there, always watching. Yes, if a game is difficult it doesn’t mean it is bad, but if a game is frustratingly difficult then it is another thing. I can count the number of times I died and there was almost no way I could have stopped it.

While the first one was scary and the third had some interesting mechanics this one is just a mess. I spent hours on night 6 and when I finaly beat it, I was kind of disappointed.  I have beaten all custom nights and it really wasn't worth it. I only beat night 7 by cheating, I you place your mouse on freddy's nose then hold C and D then press the plus on the number pad. You will then advance the the victory screen. This game has a lot of custom plushies but they are super hard to get, unless you have help. The theory is that is was a way to test out AI on later nights so scott could skip. I don't know what this has to do with anything, I just think this is a cool trick left over from game development.

Honestly the FNAF series which started off simple has spun out of control with an insane fanbase that acts like this series is the best thing since super mario. I have one question to pose to all that read this review, is this series really worth all the praise it has been getting? Oh and I think is game is over priced, when I first saw a the first game I thought it was a freeware inde game. when I found out it had a price tag I was confused. onestly I wish all the Five Nights games were free, the only reason I am hard on this game is because it is the not as good sequel the the first, and I cost three dollars more!

reviewText: So much trial and error but that's what makes this game fun. Also the new Chica loses her beak when she roams and attacks for some reason. I don't know if this is a glitch or intended. That's a bit interesting and maybe a couple of theories can explain it. Other than that, the atmosphere is somewhat similar which may disappoint some players who previously played the first game but it still does bring in the scares. New patterns, new animatronics, new methods, and new easter eggs too! Compared to the first, this is somewhat more challenging since there's a new defense mechanism" which is a mask and is somewhat effective but only for a couple of animatronics. You'll know more as the night progresses.\n\ntl;dr It's new
hoursPlayed: and it may open up new theories about the story of Five Nights at Freddy's. I definitely recommend you buy this game because to me

reviewText:
The game could be better. The original horror aspect is lessened by the threat of power (Which in this game means Foxy is going to get you, but others can be avoided easily.) The puppet is more of a pain in the rear than anything. It does give you more of a jump the first time the music box runs out, or the first few times that old Bonnie or Chica appear when you put the camera down, but after that there is a decrease in the scare factor. I have made it all the way to night 3 so far without dying, but the game was already as challenging as night 3-4 of the original. I wish there would have been more of a haunting atmosphere, which I will admit is hard to pull off with this being a (SPOILER ALERT) prequel. I still want to know what is up with Toy Chica losing her beak when she moves around, makes her look more like a round faced Pikachu than anything, but it is still creepy when you see it. There are some glitches in the game, such as Foxy jumping out from the walls when your not looking directly down the hallway, or him popping out of your camera from time to time. These really need to be fixed, maybe by having a slightly longer cut scene for it where it forces you to look down the hallway. It wouldn't hurt as well to give the animatronics some slightly different death animation and attack screams. Just like at Chuck E. Cheese, the animatronics each have different voices so that needs to be brought out more. That's why it was hard to tell in the first game whether Bonnie was a boy or a girl at first glance. And don't even get me started on BB.

Overall, the scares are still there and are hightened by the ammount of things that are going on, the number of animatronics, and the new mechanics. The only issue is that gameplay is interupted by the music box mechanic, but it redeems itself by adding time constrainted suspence. Do you go for the music box or make sure that Foxy doesn't jump you?


Mechanics -8/10
Scares - 8/10
Gameplay - 9/10
Design - 10/10
Challenge - Very Challenging if you do not have a good strategy
Rage - Minor Raging early on, but get over it.
Glitch Fixes - Foxy coming from walls and cameras, Toy Chica's beak dissapearing(?)

Overall - 8.5/10

I Highly Recommend this game and I hope you all enjoy it.

IF YOU HAVEN'T PLAYED THE ORIGINAL, GO PLAY THAT ONE FIRST
I RECOMMEND PLAYING THE DEMO VERSION FIRST BEFORE YOU DECIDE TO BUY (Night 1 and 2 on demo)

reviewText: Welcome to your new summer job at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza!"\n\nA familiar voice over the phone welcomes you as you settle once more into the dark halls of Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. However
recommended: the experience is far from what you remember from the original.\n\nNo doors to hide behind. The Animatronics you know and fear will be up and close with you
hoursPlayed: wandering in and out of your Office sanctuary. Your only defense? An empty Freddy Fazbear head and quick reflexes.\n\nThis time around
voteText: more of the grim story behind the Animatronics and the Pizzeria is revealed and the terror-factor of the game is ramped up a great deal more than the previous game. The traditional five night story is back again
helpfulPercent: along with the bonus Sixth Night
votesHelpful: which also factors into the story
votesTotal: unlike the first game.\n\nOne other unique addition is the multiple challenges of the Seventh Night
votesFunny: each one granting an aesthetic reward upon completion.\n\nAll in all
commentsCount:
this game is still worthy of the title of "Scariest Game Ever" and has once again proven that this series and developer Scott Cawthon are ones to watch in the future. Easily worthy of a 9/10. Buy this game now and challenge yourself to face your fears!

And remember....

Don't wake the baby.....

So, a friend of mine bought me FNAF 2.  I really wasn't prepared to play it as I haven't finished playing the first FNAF but my boyfriend's daughter has been wanting me to play it, so I did...with so much hesitation.

Night 1 was a piece of cake, Desi was sitting there wanting to listen for the cues for me.

Night 2...
(The second play through)
Me: I can do this! the second night wasn't too hard on the first FNAF,
Me: (BB is in the vent) NO! NO NO NO! GO AWAY! (I didn't know how to get rid of him)
(BB comes in and starts laughing at me)
Desi: Check your hallway light!
Me: I can't! BB broke everything
Me: I'm screwed....
Desi: Foxy is gonna get ya
Me: (Flailing) I KNOW Foxy is gonna ge- (Foxy jumps out)

10/10 This game is freakin hard

reviewText: i adore the five nghts at freddys concept when the game was released but ive seen i few problems , i IMMEDIATELY dont like the music box not because it makes the game a bigger challenge but because ive noticed it taking away from my ability to check all the rooms as proper from the first game , i dont like being forced out of the camera when an animatronic is in the room(thats not a real problem , it adds to the scares :3)  , id like for new chica to have a walk in animation like new bonnie (that isnt a real problem but itd be cool) , i got jumpscared just from clicking play" i did not expect it
date: i miss the old concept where bonnie was the only one out on night one and then it progressivly got worse now im seeing freddy on night one (thats not a real big issue but it is when i cant check him because of the damn music box) i do love the game and i do recommend it  10/10 would lose blood flow to my legs again also the last time i played i got killed by old foxy...now i have no courage to play this game ever again"

reviewText:
I really love this series of games, and this game is even better then the first one!
The story is very interest, and even though the game can be chalked up to entirely jump scares, it has great atmosphere.

Pros:
+No more stupid power management, That always got me in the first game
+Interesting new mechanics.
+Much less feeling of safety (No Doors!)

Cons:
-Experienced a few bugs
-What's with the lower resolution?

reviewText: I like the gameplay of it. I'll admit that the difficulty is frustrating, but that's what gives this game its flame. It actually makes you work towards the clock changes from 5 to 6. I have yet to complete it, and the anticipation for that completion is burgeoning by the second. I'll give it a 10/10 for the difficult, added gameplay elements, those little mini-games within the game, and the outstanding tension bolstered by these creepy creatures!
